tasks.task: Farming equipment operation: Subtasks are starting a tractor (turning it on), guiding the tractor (maneuvering it through the field), operating a plow attachment (attaching it, adjusting settings, operating levers), and navigating the field (observing terrain, making turns). Then, after planting, subtasks would be checking to ensure no damage (making sure the tractor didn't cause any issues), which could relate to soil compaction or other physical damage. Then MAINTASK: Planting seeds: Subtasks include loading the planter with seeds (correctly loading, ensuring even distribution), positioning seeds in the soil (using the planter correctly, ensuring proper spacing and depth), ensuring correct planting depth (adjusting the planter settings), and then after planting, checking the rows to see if everything was done properly (looking for missed spots or overly deep seeds). Then the MAINTASK: Checking the tractor: Subtasks are inspecting for any issues (looking for any signs of wear or damage), greasing moving parts (maintaining lubrication), tightening loose nuts and bolts (to prevent loosening during operation), and replacing any worn parts (like belts, filters, etc.). Each of these seems like a key physical task a farmer would perform.
